SEARCH
Package nz.ac.wgtn.swen225.lc.domain.Entity

Class Player

java.lang.Object
nz.ac.wgtn.swen225.lc.domain.Entity.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Entity
public class Player extends Object implements Entity
Represents the Player character in the game, providing functionality for movement, interaction with game items, and game status checks.

      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • checkMove

      public int checkMove(char keyEvent)
      Checks if the player can move in the specified direction and performs the move if valid.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - The character key representing the move direction.
      Returns:
      An integer representing the type of tile the player moved to or interacted with.

    • tryOpenAdjacentLockedDoor

      public boolean tryOpenAdjacentLockedDoor()
      Attempts to open any adjacent locked doors that the player has a matching key for.
      Returns:
      true if the player opened a locked door; false otherwise.

    • lockedDoorOpen

      public boolean lockedDoorOpen(ArrayList<Tile> doors)
      Checks and opens locked doors from a provided list of tiles if the player has a matching key.
      Parameters:
      doors - A list of tiles to check for locked doors.
      Returns:
      true if a locked door was opened; false otherwise.

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer(Tile newPos, Coord loc)
      Moves the player to a new position on the board. This method updates the player's location, handles the transition of the player's entity from its current tile to the new tile, and ensures the integrity of the board's state.
      Parameters:
      newPos - The tile to which the player is moving.
      loc - The coordinate of the new tile position.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the original player position is not found on the board.

    • checkTreasures

      public boolean checkTreasures(ArrayList<Tile> doors)
      Checks if the player has collected all the required treasures to unlock the exit. This method assesses whether the player has all the treasures needed to open an ExitLock. If the player does possess the required treasures and an ExitLock tile is found among the provided tiles, the ExitLock is replaced with a FreeTile, thereby unlocking the exit.
      Parameters:
      doors - A list of tiles to check for the presence of an ExitLock.
      Returns:
      true if all required treasures are with the player and the exit was unlocked; false otherwise.

    • getKeys

      public ArrayList<Key> getKeys()
      Retrieves a list of keys the player currently has.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable list of keys the player possesses.

    • getTreasure

      public ArrayList<Treasure> getTreasure()
      Retrieves a list of treasures the player currently has.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable list of treasures the player possesses.

    • getLocation

      public Coord getLocation()
      Gets the current location of the player on the board.
      Specified by:
      getLocation in interface Entity
      Returns:
      The player's location represented as coordinates.

      public Coord getTrueLocation()
      Retrieves the true location of the player by flipping X and Y coordinates.
      Returns:
      The true location of the player.

    • changeDir

      public void changeDir(char keyCode)
      Changes the player's orientation based on the provided key code. Useful for updating the sprite's direction in the game.
      Parameters:
      keyCode - The key representing the direction ('w' for north, 'a' for west, etc.).

    • getDirection

      public Orientation getDirection()
      Retrieves the current orientation of the player.
      Returns:

    • interact

      public static void interact(Player player, Coord loc)
      Allows the player to interact with an entity at a specific location. This interaction can result in collecting keys or treasures.
      Parameters:
      player - The player entity.
      loc - The location to check for interaction.
